column5: Thats an incredible huge walleye! Congrats on a once in a lifetime fish. (maybe there is more for you though)  Always went to mouth of Talbot R. on Simcoe in last week of March to get big 'pickies'. Ended up getting my PB of over 16 lbs. there over 10 yrs. ago.  I've seen near 20 lbs. fish coming off the ice there caught by locals. With the season now closed March 15th on Simcoe it really protects these fish around the Talbot.  Always swore there was world record walleye in Simcoe. Now with the new season its like finding a needle in 100 haystacks.  Congrats on that huge and rare walleye from Simcoe.  ehg
beauty! Nice to know shes still swimmin too!
Wow now you would think with all the time Terry spends on Simcoe he would have some fish like that  Nice Hog on Simcoe to boot
awesome fish man ...some real nice walleye being pulled out of simcoe
Amazing!  Easton
Nice fish! Congrats on the pb.
Very Nice Eye! They do get very big there! I fish for them in the fall on Simcoe and we get some real hogs! Congrats on the PB!
Aweomse fish.... she takes her weight right back to the tail. Reproduction is in order !!!!!!!
Wow what a beauty, WTG...
wow that is a huge walleye for any lake!  I have heard that when you catch eyes in simcoe alot of them are big but that one was a true monster!  contrats!  Cheers!
Very nice fish and a great release.
what type of jig is that? A foxee minnow?
WOW! That is a beast of a walleye. Congrats.  -R-
fish of a lifetime mine is a 16lbs now we keeping trying for bigger one
Nice fish Greg. I'm glad to see walleye caught in Simcoe. I read an article a few years ago that talked about how bad the walleye population had declined in Simcoe.

Nice one.  Simcoe has some big walleye's and a few show up every year off the east side out in the "trout" grounds. My buddy poked one 11.5 a few years back on a whitefish tip up and a pinhead minnow.  Just goes to show you the size and quality of the walleye run that goes up the Talbot river. Very impressive catch
WOW  Congrats Greg, that is one splendid fish!!!  Joey
WOW!! Gotta love that 24 carat gold beauty. From Simcoe none the less. Awesome!
very nice clean eye,WTG  Hawg Hunter
Nice looking eye Greg. It's been awhile, maybe 5-7 years since we caught walleye from Simcoe. We get them in the spring while we are pike fishing and they are from cooks bay around 5-6 lbs.
Thumb up. There are some monsters in Beaverton area.
What a healthy looking fish.  Great pics and congrats on the PB
Congrats on your new PB Greg!

Nater and Jat... sorry the delayed reply but have been out on Simcoe nailing some nice Whities and Lakers the past few days and not been on the PC..... Yes that was one of the new Blue Fox Foxee Minnows (Humpback) jigs.  That was one of two different colours I designed for them that they put into production.... the small size really nails the Jumbo Perch too!.....Greg.
Thats a beautifull eye for sure....Way to go on the PB!  Just curious did you take any measurments? I'd love to know for poops and giggles
Atta boy
wow ! ... I mean ... WOW !!!!  Been many years since I chased Pickerel on Simcoe with any success ... congrats  ... and nice camera work  Thanks for sharing
She sure looks nice and healthy! Congratulations on a beautiful fish and a quick release!
That is superb catch !  Oh I just realized that your member number is '666'.  No wonder you're a kick ass fisherman.

Was out on Simcoe this past w/e working some of my GPS laker/Whitefish spots and got a real surprize..... my new PB Walleye estimated at 15lb or more.  My previous best was a 13.5lb fish taken from Quinte and few years back and it was definately dwarfed by this gut busting eye laiden female Walleye.  3 other anglers came over to see the fish and figured it was at least 15lbs of more as they have taken a 12lb fish before and said it was so much smaller then this one. I released her after a couple of quick pics and still can't believe I was able to pull her out of the hole!!  I was working the bottom slowly with a jig in approx. 50ft of water.      Take care and good luck out there..... Greg.
Very Cool!!!
Congrats on the PB Greg, I've never even heard of them like that in Simcoe. By the way also very nice to see it released to fight another day. Congrats again.
awesome fish,congrats on the pb
Phenominal catch, congratulations!
Nice fish greg...Curious if you had the foxee jig tipped with a pinhead or if he hit just the bare jig?  great walleye for simcoe, and awesome to hear that it went back to swim another day  Nate
That thing is HUGE!!! Congrats.
Nice Eye Greg!
This guy is always catching big fish!!!  Congrats on the pb!   lovetofish
Awesome Walleye Greg !!!!!.  ..congrats on the new PB !!!  cheers
Holly sweet teats that's a big eye.  Great shots too!  Well done.  and props on the release.  Goes to show that a gradual ascenssion means no protruding air bladders.  Right on brotha!  cheers HD
Greg great work on a trophy walleye. What a nice surprise that was. Cheers AL www.alsadventures.ca
WOW!!!!  congrats and nice release
Whoa, what a beast, nice catch, she was probably stuffed to the brim with eggs, nice release.
Yowzers!!!!
I saw the pic and that oh yeah, another BOQ fish then I reread the thread title.  Wow, thats damned impressive (hell thats impressive for any body of water).  Love that last pic too.  Congrats
Amazing
that one beautiful walleye!
holy !!! beauty fish Greg!!
I think my eyes got bigger than the fish's when I saw those pics -- nicely done!
Congrats on your PB that is a awesome eye  rob
Awesome catch!
I will speak for me and my second cousin, A Fine FISH!!  Terry was the last I saw that caught a fish in that class but smaller, but that was 5 years ago.  Tremendous!
What a walleye! WTG on the PB, and great pics
There are pickerel in Simcoe???  Awesome catch!  I would walk a thousand miles to catch one that size through the ice.
